article.title: Investigating early-type galaxy evolution with a multiwavelength approach. II. The UV structure of 11 galaxies with Swift-UVOT

multiple_choice_question.text: Which statement is **TRUE** about the coincidence loss effects observed in this figure?
choices: Coincidence loss affects all UVOT filters equally.
Coincidence loss is most prominent in the U, B, and V filters.
NUV filters are completely immune to coincidence loss.
Coincidence loss effects are always corrected for point sources but not for extended sources.

multiple_choice_question.text: In which UVOT filter do the authors\' measurements differ most significantly from those of Hodges-Kluck & Bregman (2014)?
Which statement best summarizes the comparison between the authors\' integrated magnitudes and those from the literature?
choices: The authors\' magnitudes are consistently fainter than those from all other catalogs.
The authors\' magnitudes are generally consistent with those from the literature, within errors.
The authors\' magnitudes are only consistent with those from the CGS catalog.
Discrepancies are significant in all filters for all galaxies.

multiple_choice_question.text: What trend is observed for the Sérsic indices of elliptical galaxies (T<-4) across wavelengths?
choices: Sérsic indices significantly decrease with decreasing wavelength (NIR to NUV).
Sérsic indices significantly increase with decreasing wavelength (NIR to NUV).
Sérsic indices remain relatively constant across wavelengths.
No clear trend can be observed for elliptical galaxies.
